status.name: In QA

fields.description:
SC is staying in initialized after rebooting the enabled system. 
This is happening in our GA run, and easily reproduced manually. 

The output below represents a system which was running with enabled components on 192.168.51.65, and this machine was rebooted. Some components failed over while others did not. It appears the components which did not fail over remain in 'INITIALIZED'. The faulted triggers excessive timeouts in QA waiting for post failover operations to succeed (ie: run-instances) 
Thanks,
-M

{code}

[root@eucahost-51-64 matt]# euca-describe-services 
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	192.168.51.64  	ENABLED   	549 	http://192.168.51.64:8773/services/Dns  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:192.168.51.64/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	192.168.51.64  	ENABLED   	549 	http://192.168.51.64:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::192.168.51.64/
SERVICE	cluster        	PARTI00        	CC_64          	ENABLED   	549 	http://192.168.51.64:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:cluster:CC_64/
SERVICE	cluster        	PARTI00        	CC_65          	DISABLED  	549 	http://192.168.51.65:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:cluster:CC_65/
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_64          	INITIALIZED	549 	http://192.168.51.64:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_64/
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_65          	ENABLED   	549 	http://192.168.51.65:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_65/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	WS_64          	INITIALIZED	549 	http://192.168.51.64:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:WS_64/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	WS_65          	ENABLED   	549 	http://192.168.51.65:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:WS_65/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.51.64  	ENABLED   	549 	http://192.168.51.64:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.51.64/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.51.65  	DISABLED  	549 	http://192.168.51.65:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.51.65/


192.168.51.64	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[UI CLC WS SC00 CC00]
192.168.51.65	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CLC WS SC00 CC00]
192.168.51.66	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]

{code}
fields.summary: HA flop on reboot failing to recover secondary SC and Walrus

comments.body:
Reproducible through:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eutester/blob/testing/testcases/cloud_admin/ha.py

On a PoC (single frontend) HA topology by running with:

./ha.py --config <config> --tests failoverCLC

Vic, just to verify: This only happens in HA, on a failover to the secondary SC? And it looks like Walrus also remained initialized. So, is this problem with Eucalyptus components in general and it was caught initially by looking at the SC?

Is there a work-around for this?

Scot,

This was only seen in the POC topology, on reboot of the ENABLED frontend.
After the reboot you end up with one WS and SC in ENABLED and one WS and SC
in disabled. I was able to fix this by restarting the INITIALIZED
components. Another possible workaround is to use euca-modify-service but i
have not yet verified that one.

On Mon, Dec 10, 2012 at 2:02 PM, Scot Marvin (JIRA) <




-- 

*_________________________*

*Victor Iglesias - *Quality Engineer

*Eucalyptus Systems*

www.eucalyptus.com

Follow us on Twitter <http://twitter.com/#!/eucalyptuscloud>

Like our Facebook
Page<http://www.facebook.com/pages/Eucalyptus-Systems-Inc/164828240204708>

Keep up-to-date with
us<http://go.eucalyptus.com/Sign-Up-for-Cloud-Computing-News.html?Offer=Other&OfferDetails=Sign%20Up%20for%20Cloud%20Computing%20News&LeadSourceDetails=Eucalyptus%20Website&OfferURL=http%3A%2F%2Fgo.eucalyptus.com%2FSign-Up-for-Cloud-Computing-News.html>

*_________________________*
Thanks, Vic. So . . . what do we mean by POC in this case? FastStart? Cloud-in-a-box install from FastStart? Download from the site and put all components on whatever machines are under the desk?

Sorry Scot.

The POC deployment of HA is 3 nodes with the components in the following topology:

[CLC WS CC00 SC00]
[CLC WS CC00 SC00]
[NC00]

A bit more info.

I have found in testing that this failure has only been reproducible when
the ENABLED components are as follows:

Machine 1: CC
Machine 2: CLC WS SC

When all ENABLED components are on the same machine I was not able to
reproduce.

On Mon, Dec 10, 2012 at 2:16 PM, Scot Marvin (JIRA) <




-- 

*_________________________*

*Victor Iglesias - *Quality Engineer

*Eucalyptus Systems*

www.eucalyptus.com

Follow us on Twitter <http://twitter.com/#!/eucalyptuscloud>

Like our Facebook
Page<http://www.facebook.com/pages/Eucalyptus-Systems-Inc/164828240204708>

Keep up-to-date with
us<http://go.eucalyptus.com/Sign-Up-for-Cloud-Computing-News.html?Offer=Other&OfferDetails=Sign%20Up%20for%20Cloud%20Computing%20News&LeadSourceDetails=Eucalyptus%20Website&OfferURL=http%3A%2F%2Fgo.eucalyptus.com%2FSign-Up-for-Cloud-Computing-News.html>

*_________________________*

Is there an option if we aren't going to change code for 3.2, could we look at making some changes to the init script around kicking the cloud process after some time to see if that can help remediate the issue in 3.2?

The set of issues identified by the above linked ticket EUCA-4366 are contributors to this issue.  Note that they are largely addressed in 3.2.  Vic can maybe say more, but any remaining issue that causes symptoms similar to this would be more related to booting the system and not HA problem, per se.  That is, they might occur exclusively in an HA setup in how we test now, but are not (as far as I can tell) exclusive to HA.

Fixes went into maint/3.2/testing this morning in:

commit 5ab725725c849b46e4f16d8b8a73143b237bbb6f
Merge: dac3f31 5a2a4c4
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Mon Dec 10 11:18:28 2012 -0800

    Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/dev/grze/ha.fixup' into maint/3.2/testing

commit 5a2a4c4ab634584ee3f5b8a4d6c6cbdb188cc104
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 9 14:23:47 2012 -0800

    Fixes to EUCA-4366 around interesting join/part interleavings and hard failures
    
    EUCA-4362 - Avoid unsafe modification of host map from the viewChange calling thread
    EUCA-4364 - Make channel startup and membership checking changes needed per
    EUCA-4363 - Handle fail stops after a network partition and fixes per JGRP-751.
    EUCA-4365 - Host remove shouldn't do destroy, transition done async to avoid timeout situation.

commit b958d6702d7cdf9092fc2b81a0dbe75d0853f539
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 9 13:50:55 2012 -0800

    EUCA-4366, EUCA-4364, and EUCA-4363 - Handle fail stops after a network partition and fixes per JGRP-751.

commit fa0e37514894517b538798560c6f7d17b10a076a
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 9 13:34:42 2012 -0800

    EUCA-4361 - Adjust handling of propery value updates in state transition to be safer.
No longer seeing this failure using the script mentioned above.

Spoke too soon.

In automated QA runs this was reproduced. It looks like the race condition is even narrower than previously thought. My testing today was doing reboot tests in serial which did not reproduce the problem. The problem seems to only manifest when a service stop failure of the CLC (causing all services but the CC to be evicted) followed by a reboot failure of the now [CLC SC WS] causes the system to lock up in this way. 

Was able to use a restart on the cloud process for the INITIALIZED components in order to get them back into working order.

Okay, I'm a tad confused again. This isn't confined to HA? And this occurs when there's a failure in stopping the CLC service AND reboot failures in the CLC, SC, AND Walrus? Or when there's a failure in stopping the CLC service AND reboot failures in either the CLC, SC or Walrus?

Or something else entirely?

And the workaround is still to restart the service that says it is INITIALIZED?

Workaround is still to restart the service that says it is INITIALIZED.

This is localized to HA. 

This has only been seen when rebooting the box that has the ENABLED CLC,WS,SC and those services are failing over to the box that is hosting the CC.
It appears Chris is already working on the related issue EUCA-4366.
Should this be marked as Release Pending? Is QA satisfied?
The original issue has not been resolved.

Okay cool! Can we get content for the linked DOC issue (known issue).

Thanks!
In discussion with [~decker], this issue is believed to have been fixed in 3.3.0. This should be validated against 3.3.1.
